title: Here Are the Most Significant Findings Against the Minneapolis Police

title: In Trump Prosecution, Special Counsel Seeks to Avoid Distracting Fights
abstract: Jack Smith has taken an iron-fist-in-a-kid-glove approach, sidestepping secondary issues that could divert attention from the weight of the evidence he has assembled in his case against the former president.

title: See How the G.O.P. Has Reacted to the Trump Indictment

title: Daniel Ellsberg, Who Leaked the Pentagon Papers, Is Dead at 92
abstract: Deeply disturbed by the accounting of American deceit in Vietnam, he approached The New York Times. The disclosures that followed rocked the nation.

title: Hundreds Dead, 9 Arrested, and Many Questions in Migrant Wreck
abstract: Greek authorities blamed smugglers for a disaster that may have been one of the worst of its kind. Critics say tougher policies are increasing the risks.

title: Southern Baptists’ Fight Over Female Leaders Shows Power of Insurgent Right
abstract: Moves this week to oust women from church leadership in the nation’s largest Protestant denomination offer an early look into the psyche of evangelical America ahead of 2024.

title: The Titanic Truthers of TikTok
abstract: On the short-form video app, long-established facts about the 1912 disaster at sea are being newly litigated as musty rumors merge with fresh misinformation and manipulated content.
byline: By Tiffany Hsu and Sapna Maheshwari

title: Trump and Johnson Were Accused of Breaking Rules. One Lost Party Support.

title: Boris Johnson, Out of Parliament, Is a Columnist Again
abstract: Britain’s former prime minister, who quit as a lawmaker in the face of a possible suspension for misleading statements about pandemic gatherings, will write for The Daily Mail, a tabloid.

title: ‘I Cannot Believe We Made It’: In the Flood, a Rescue Behind the Front
abstract: To many, the destruction of a dam on the Dnipro River in Ukraine brought devastation. To some stranded in Russian-occupied territory, it brought freedom.
byline: By Andrew E. Kramer and Maria Varenikova

title: Ukraine Nuclear Plant in No Near-Term Risk After Dam Breach, U.N. Says
abstract: The destruction of a dam endangered the main source of water used for the critical task of cooling Zaporizhzhia’s reactors and spent fuel rods.

title: Accused in Missing Man’s Grisly Killing: His Ex-Wife and Her Husband
abstract: Three years ago, Steven Kraft disappeared. This week, Jamie and Nicholas Orsini were arrested and accused of carrying out an elaborate plot to kill him and dispose of his body.
des_facet: ['Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides']
multimedia: [{'url': 'https://static01.nyt.com/images/2023/06/15/multimedia/15ny-killing-hbpk/15ny-killing-hbpk-superJumbo.jpg', 'format': 'Super Jumbo', 'height': 1365, 'width': 2048, 'type': 'image', 'subtype': 'photo', 'caption': 'Damian Williams, the U.S. attorney for the Southern District of New York, said Jamie and Nicholas Orsini denied Steven Kraft’s family the “dignity of a proper burial” when they killed him.', 'copyright': 'Jefferson Siegel for The New York Times'}, {'url': 'https://static01.nyt.com/images/2023/06/15/multimedia/15ny-killing-hbpk/15ny-killing-hbpk-threeByTwoSmallAt2X.jpg', 'format': 'threeByTwoSmallAt2X', 'height': 400, 'width': 600, 'type': 'image', 'subtype': 'photo', 'caption': 'Damian Williams, the U.S. attorney for the Southern District of New York, said Jamie and Nicholas Orsini denied Steven Kraft’s family the “dignity of a proper burial” when they killed him.', 'copyright': 'Jefferson Siegel for The New York Times'}, {'url': 'https://static01.nyt.com/images/2023/06/15/multimedia/15ny-killing-hbpk/15ny-killing-hbpk-thumbLarge.jpg', 'format': 'Large Thumbnail', 'height': 150, 'width': 150, 'type': 'image', 'subtype': 'photo', 'caption': 'Damian Williams, the U.S. attorney for the Southern District of New York, said Jamie and Nicholas Orsini denied Steven Kraft’s family the “dignity of a proper burial” when they killed him.', 'copyright': 'Jefferson Siegel for The New York Times'}]

title: After an Epic Meltdown, Ample Hills Creamery Aims to Rise Again
abstract: The Brooklyn-based ice cream chain boomed with the help of Oprah and Disney, then went bust. But the couple behind it are opening new shops and thinking small.
des_facet: ['Ice Cream and Frozen Desserts', 'Mergers, Acquisitions and Divestitures', 'Entrepreneurship']

title: What a Motherless Son Knows About Fatherhood
abstract: It would be fair to compare my cumulative understanding of grief and fatherhood, which I’ve acquired intuitively, incrementally and in fragments, to a carefully constructed sequence of images.

title: Deadlocked Iowa Supreme Court Leaves Abortion Legal Through 20 Weeks
abstract: The court split 3-3 on whether to revive a much stricter six-week limit, enacted in 2018, that was struck down before Roe v. Wade was overturned.

title: Tornadoes Kill at Least 4 Across the South
abstract: One tornado destroyed a trailer park as it pummeled the Texas Panhandle city of Perryton, where three people died. Another person was killed in Florida.
byline: By Livia Albeck-Ripka and Mike Ives

title: Conservatives Poised to Lead Finland in Coalition with Hard Right
abstract: When the party of the country’s political rock star, former Prime Minister Sanna Marin, lost in April, a center-right party’s power rose.
